captions.text: The futuristic race arena Yas Marina.
Perhaps the most modern race track worldwide,
it's most famous for its Formula 1 night races,
illuminated by floodlights.
This is where Matthias will race his unknown competitor.
But the fast and sometimes tight curves,
call for a new weapon.

That's why
I got myself a different car.

It's a BMW M5,
also tuned by PP-performance.

And it definitely
takes corners better than the X6.
The BMW M5 has only been on the market for a few months.
This one is the first tuned M5 of the new generation,
worldwide.
The specs:
0 to 60 in 3.9 seconds.
Max speed electronically limited to 193 mph.
In his ominous invitation, the Arab names a specific garage
as the meeting spot.
So, we're in garage 19.

I see tons of competition
sitting around:
Alpina M6,
BMW M5,
and a brand new M6 convertible.

But there's no driver.
Where is he?
He's heading this way, driving something very different.
Something Matthias wasn't expecting at all:
something Italian.
What the heck is that?
Okay, I get it.
A 485 Italia.

Hello. You don't look Arab.
- I'm not. I'm Mike.

Hello. Matthias.
- Hi.

I was supposed to meet
an Arab for a race.

I know. I heard.
- So where's the Arab?

Were you in a drag race last night?
- Yes.

Well apparently
you left a pretty big impression.

Yeah?
- They all backed out.

They're scared stiff?
- That's right.

So they called me up
and asked me to drive.

Why you?
Are you a racecar driver?

I'm an instructor for safety training.
- Shit.
An instructor in a 458 Italia?

Against my M5?
That's gonna be tough.
Whatever. We're here now.

As long as you can keep up.
- Right.

Shall we do it?
- Sure.

Okay.
Have fun and be careful.
They love German handiwork in Abu Dhabi,
that's why Matthias was expecting to race a BMW, Mercedes or Porsche,
but just the idea of racing a Ferrari leaves a bad taste in his mouth.

The Ferrari 458 Italia
is so freaking aggressive.

Something would have to go wrong,
for me to come out in front.
Modesty is good, right?
The 458 Italia:
A super athlete bred explicitly for driving fast.
Fighting weight: just 1.4 tons.
562 hp from a 4.5 liter naturally aspirated V8 engine.
Max speed: 201 mph.
Rear wheel drive, super vicious brakes.
The Italians would call this beauty "Bella Macchina."
Its price: 200,000 euros.
Did Matthias finally get the short end of the stick?
The M5 is 1,322 pounds heavier,
but it boasts 69 hp more than the Ferrari.
The competitors duel head-to-head for two laps.
But Mike is off to a bad start.
So, that was the start.
And the Ferrari is behind me.
I like that.
In the lighter Ferrari Mike can break a bit later,
but he can't catch up on the short straightaways.

Now I've just got
to stay in the lead somehow.
Tooth and nail right from the beginning.
The kid's really flooring it.
But here we come!
The track is sizzling hot.
The asphalt is 132.8 degrees.
What's going on?
A nightmare for the tires and engine, and the Ferrari can't gain ground.
I can't believe he's still behind me!
The naturally aspirated Ferrari engine is losing power in the heat.
For now, Matthias's sedan is still in the lead.
But here come the really tight curves.
That was too big a drift.
On the way to the last curve before the finish,
Mike edges closer and closer to the M5.
All it takes is another wide drift,
and the Ferrari closes in.
Come on, let me pass.

Come on!
- I don't believe it! Get lost! No!
Bye!
No way!
Yes way, but Mike makes a mistake and Matthias gets right on his tail.
Surprisingly, the BMW can hold its own in this unequal duel.
But Matthias has to fight like hell.
So, how can I pass him?
Hello, I have to pass you somehow!
But before the bridge,
he drifts by accident.
Stop doing that.
Drifting doesn't make you fast.
Last chance.
Just half a mile and two curves till the finish.
They're both going all out.
But this time, the Ferrari hits the straightaway just right.

I drifted too far in the last curve!
No way!
No way!
Unbelievable!
Man, was that close!
Mike may have restored the Arab's honor with the Ferrari,
but we've rarely seen Matthias so happy after losing a race.
My goodness, that was a close race!

It was close, eh?
- Crazy! Were you flooring it?

Not even close.
- Yeah, yeah. Right!
Incredible.

Mine weighs two tons and you?
2,998 pounds or something?

Too bad I didn't have a good start.
- But I did.

Yeah, I saw that.
Then I had to catch up.

I had to hit the gas twice,
but then it was easy.
No, I'm kidding. It was hard work.

It was an awesome race,
especially when you passed me.
You just inched by slowly:

And the best part
was when I could do this:
Bye. That was good.

Okay.
- I liked that.
Mike, good race.
It was really tough, surprisingly.

I thought the 1322 pound difference
and the hp difference

would be more noticeable
on the track, but it wasn't.
The BMW held its own very, very well.

Every time the BMW
swung out of a curve

the Ferrari
had a hard time catching up.
That's so intense,

because if you've got
a super sports car like the 458 Italia,

and you only manage
to inch by a BMW,
even a tuned one...

I thought it would fly past me.
That was awesome.

When a 5-seater touring sedan
holds its own
against a 2-seater super sports car...
The M5 is pretty darn impressive.
The heat left its mark...
but only on the Ferrari.
It's in dire need of a pit stop, while the BMW never even flinched.
The Italian diva is suffering from incontinence.
The Ferrari is leaking boiling engine coolant.
120 DEGREES

So, that's it for civilized
motorsports in Abu Dhabi.

We're heading off
with some standard transportation:

a Rolls Royce.
This one is one of a kind.

The Rolls Royce Phantom
Rayan Edition.

There's really just one of them
in the whole world.

And it's going to take me
to the airport.
Cheerio!
One thing's for sure, Abu Dhabi, the land of hp fanatics,
hasn't seen the last of Matthias.
He had way too much fun for that.

comments.author: plasticboy81

comments.text:
Vielleicht solltet ihr mal ueber de Folgen berichten die der allmaechtige 
Salah und sein Team von Super PP-Performance hier in UAE anrichten. Ich bin 
Werkstattleiter einer deutschen Marke in Abu Dhabi und habe regelmaessig 
Faelle in denen Kunden Folgeschaeden oder sogar lebensgefaehrliche 
Situationen erleiden durch dieses Tuning. Teilweise sind die tuning 
Methoden wie im Kindergarten, zB Kats ausleeren bei Turbo Motoren. 
Natuerlich wird dem Kunden erklaert das sie immer noch Garantie haben 
obwohl ihr Auto getunt ist, sie muessen halt nur beim Tuner vorher 
vorbeikommen bevor sie zur Vertragsverkstatt fahren um die Software 
zuueckzuspielen. Die Leittragenden sind die Haendler die zumindest 
versuchen irgendwie einen deutschen Standard hier in UAE einzufuehren aber 
gegen solche Machenschaften keine Chance haben,﻿

comments.text:
Wer sagt denn, dass der aufgeladene Motor keinen Leistungsverlust hat?
Zwar ist es wohl nicht so schlimm wie beim Sauger, aber bestimmt trotzdem 
ordentlich.

Heiße Luft: Geringere Dichte als kalte Luft!
D.h. in den Brennraum passt bei Hitze weniger LuftMASSE --> weniger Leistung
Klar kann da der ATL helfen, nämlich indem er den Kolben "vollstopft"!!

Ein schönes Rennen﻿
comments.author: maigl sommer

comments.text:
Das ist soweit richtig, aber genau das besagt ja die dichte: weniger masse 
(moleküle) in gleichem volumen = niedrigere dichte!
Aber egal wie mans jetzt ausdrückt, das ergebnis ist das selbe.
comments.author: maigl sommer

comments.text:
+wulfgang1994 Ja genau das hat aber nichts mit der Dichte zu tun! Die 
Moleküle dehnen sich bei erwärmung aus, das heisst im Klartext, in das 
selbe Volumen zb. in ein cm3 passen weniger Sauerstoffmoleküle, also in der 
Luft die angesaugt wird und sich dann mit dem Benzin vermischt sind weniger 
Sauerstoffmoleküle als in kalter Luft daher verringert sich die Leistung 
bei warmen Temperaturen!
comments.author: Calzaghe Joe

comments.text: Jeder Stoff dehnt sich aus wenn er erwärmt wird

comments.text:
Ich komm aus der Banche also ich kenn mich aus ja. Und ich glaube du 
verwechselst da was ganz gewaltig. Natürlich hat das Fahrwerk den Zweckt in 
allen lebenslagen den optimalen bodenkontakt herzustellen aber dabei geht 
es mehr um die Seitlichen G-kräfte und die querbeschleunigung in Kurven und 
die bodenhaftung bzw. stabilität bei schnellen Lastwechseln im Rennsport. 
700PS die an EINER achse reissen sind sinnlos wie nochwas. Mein alltagspolo 
läuft mit 431 PS auf allrad und das hat er auch zwingend nötig!
comments.author: HELERsx

comments.text:

dass die 548 KW des M6 G-Power Hurricane RR sauber auf die Straße gebracht 
werden, wobei auch die 285 Bereifung hinten hilft.

comments.author: Berni .B

comments.text:
begründung... ein golf erreicht nie die fahreigenschaften eines 
supersportlers der mit z.b einen mittelmotor oder einer aerodynamischen 
karosserie aus kohlefaser und einen perfekt abgestimmten fahrwerk genau für 
die rennstrecke geschaffen ist... ein ferrari 458 erreicht 
kurvengeschwindigkeiten an die der golf mächtig an seine grenzen kommt.
